programme.desc: Yash, a rich and esteemed business tycoon, yearns for real love. While he falls in love with Neha, the journey ahead is not going to be an easy one for him. Will he be able to win Nehas heart?

programme.title: Jodha Akbar
programme.sub-title: S04 : E47 Jodha Akbar S4 E47
programme.desc: Jodha Akbar is a period drama set in the sixteenth century, focusing on the political marriage between Mughal Emperor Akbar and Rajput Princess Jodha Bai. Initially a marriage of convenience, it evolves into a deep love story that changes the fate of India. The series portrays the era's wars, the complex relationships between the Mughals and Rajputs, and the political dynamics of the royal court. Akbar, raised as a ruthless conqueror, learns the meaning of love and compassion through Jodha, who despises the Mughals for their invasions. Their relationship transforms Akbar from a heartless ruler into the beloved Emperor Akbar, known for his justice and wisdom.

programme.title: This is Fate
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 This is Fate S2 E7
programme.desc: The story revolves around the two sisters of Pragya, from Kumkum Bhagya. Her sisters are Preeta and Shristhi who discover the existence of their mother Sarla and sister Pragya, after their father’s death. The sisters try to unite with their mother and sister.

programme.title: Trinayani
programme.desc: Trinayani is a woman who can see the future. She decides to use her power to make other peoples lives better. How will things turn out for her when people learn about her extraordinary abilities?

programme.title: Guddan
programme.desc: Guddan, a cheerful yet clumsy young woman, ends up marrying Akshat Jindal aka AJ, a rich businessman with three sons and daughters-in-law. How will Guddan face the challenges that await her?

programme.title: Undercover Love
programme.sub-title: S01 : E354 Undercover Love S1 E354
programme.desc: Behind the facade of running an NGO for hearing and speech impaired children, the demure Jagadhatri Sanyal is, in reality, a fiery intelligence officer code-named JAS.

programme.title: Gangaaa
programme.desc: Gangaa, a child widow, faces numerous hardships while living in a community of ultra-conservative people. However, with a blend of charm and bravery, she challenges outdated traditions.

programme.title: Mehek
programme.desc: Zindagi Ki Mehek is an Indian television drama series that aired from 2016 to 2018. The story revolves around Mehek Sharma, a talented cook from a middle-class family, and Shaurya Khanna, a wealthy and arrogant restaurateur. Their paths cross when Mehek participates in a cooking competition that Shaurya is judging. Despite their contrasting personalities and initial conflicts, they fall in love and face numerous challenges together, including family opposition and personal vendettas. The show blends themes of love, family, and ambition with a strong emphasis on culinary arts.

programme.title: Maitree
programme.sub-title: S01 : E109 Maitree: The Rules of Love S1 E109
programme.desc: The lives of three friends, Nandini, Maitree and Ashish get inexplicably intertwined when an accident brings unexpected changes in their lives.

programme.title: King of Hearts
programme.sub-title: S01 : E355 King of Hearts S1 E355
programme.desc: Jamai Raja is an Indian drama series about Siddharth, who marries Roshni to mend her strained relationship with her mother, Durga Devi Patel. The show explores the complexities of family dynamics, love, and duty as Siddharth navigates various challenges to unite his new family.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E355 Second Chances S1 E355

programme.desc: Guddan, a cheerful yet clumsy young woman, ends up marrying Akshat Jindal aka AJ, a rich businessman with three sons and daughters-in-law. How will Guddan face the challenges that await her?

programme.title: Guddan
programme.desc: Guddan, a cheerful yet clumsy young woman, ends up marrying Akshat Jindal aka AJ, a rich businessman with three sons and daughters-in-law. How will Guddan face the challenges that await her?

programme.title: Million-Dollar Toys from the Middle East
programme.desc: The McLaren MP4 12C Spider, one of many high-performance sports cars featured at the Doha Motor Show in Qatar. Also: the creations of manufacturers like Lamborghini, Bertone or Porsche but also the first Arab super sports car, the Lykan HyperSport.

programme.title: Episode 12
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Episode 13
programme.desc: The Nuerburgring shook when the VLN began its second leg of the tournament. We once again accompany you to this exciting competition, including the highlights of BMW's 1st leg win.

programme.title: Episode 13
programme.desc: The Nuerburgring shook when the VLN began its second leg of the tournament. We once again accompany you to this exciting competition, including the highlights of BMW's 1st leg win.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera World Cup
programme.desc: In June 2011 motor sports enthusiasts from all around the world eagerly awaited the start of the Porsche Carrera World Cup at the infamous Nürburgring Nordschleife. We show you some of the most exciting moments of this event.

programme.title: Audi R8 GT vs. Jaguar XKR
programme.desc: The ultimate competition: Aston Martin Virage vs. Jaguar XKR vs. Audi's R8 GT vs. Mercedes SLS. Also: Artega claims that their GT is a 'Porsche killer'. Is that so? And: Formula One champion Sebastian Vettel takes the Infinity FX50 to the test.

programme.title: Low- Price SUVs
programme.desc: Low-priced SUVs frequently lead in the sales statistics and also do fine in independent benchmark tests. We examine the pros and cons of affordable SUVs like the Suzuki Jimny, the Dacia Duster and the Russian SUV veteran, the Lada Niva.

programme.title: Powerful Estate Wagons
programme.desc: Station Wagons like the Volvo V60 Polestar aren't just family vans anymore but basically very roomy sports cars. Mercedes followed a more luxurious approach with their E43 AMG T model. And: the ultimate powerhouse station wagon, the Audi RS6.

programme.title: Bizzarrini 5300 GT
programme.desc: Giotto Bizzarrini was the creator of the famous Ferrari GTO, but after arguments with his employer he left Ferrari early. To get back at Ferrari, Bizzarrini decided to create his own sports car: the Bizzarrini GT 5300.

programme.title: French Classics
programme.desc: French manufacturers have also built milestones in automotive history in the past, including lesser-known brands such as Delage and Talbot, but also vehicles from Peugeot, Renault and Citroen.

programme.title: Cruising
programme.desc: We explored how the Z4 Roadster feels as a cabriolet. Also: the small company Boom Trikes Automotive have become Europe's leading trike manufacturer. And: cruising through Los Angeles in a Volkswagen Beetle convertible.

programme.title: Diesel Engines
programme.desc: It's all about Diesel this time. We compared the BMW 120d and the 125i. In addition: Audi's diesel-hybrid model R18 e-tron quattro dominated the endurance race in Le Mans. And: the diesel-powered Jaguar XF Sport Brake.

programme.title: Ford Mustang vs Chevy Corvette
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: Car lovers from the Middle East present their vehicles at the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. There is a weekend at the hotel to be won. A Ford Mustang and a limited edition Chevrolet Corvette are up for judging this time.

programme.title: Nova SS vs Honda Accord
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car On TV, car fans from the Middle East can have their darlings rated in terms of speed, style and sound. Included this time: a Nova SS, a special Honda Accord and a car clad in crystals.

programme.title: Jaguar RS
programme.desc: Jaguar succeeded in finding new confidence and challenging their competitors with models like the XF-RS, XK-RS and F-Type. We took a look at the iconic British brand's latest developments.

programme.title: Blancpain Endurance Series 2013
programme.desc: The Blancpain Endurance Series is a racing event for grand tourers like the Ferrari 458 Italia, the McLaren MP4-12 C or the Nissan GT-R Nismo GT3. We took a look at all the action, the drivers, their cars at the 2013 competition.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Episode 16
programme.desc: In this episode we invite you to witness the progress of driver Uwe Nittle as he got ready for qualifying at the Truck Grand Prix.

programme.title: Special - Stunt Highlights
programme.desc: This episode features Action Concept's stunt highlights from all previous specials, from exciting car stunts to meticulously choreographed fight scenes and even some snowmobile shootout action.

programme.title: Bike Crash
programme.desc: This time the team deals with motorbike stunts: high jumps, risky drops and dangerous crashes in the company's backyard. Stunt coordinator Domi requires his specialists to be in top shape and extremely focused.

programme.title: The Graduate
programme.desc: A vehicle jumps at full speed over four cars, which explode one after the other. It’s a matter of precision and timing for the Stunt Heroes. Also, up-and-coming stuntwoman Tina has to prove her skills.

programme.title: Lexus GSF vs McLaren MP4-12C
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The competition for the coolest souped-up cars in the Middle East continues. The prize is an overnight stay for two at the Sofitel Jumeirah Beach. This time, the spotlight is on a Lexus GSF, a Ford Mustang and a McLaren MP4-12C.

programme.title: Mercedes SLS vs Audi R8
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi once again invite the owners of the most extraordinary cars to Dubai, where they award points for speed, style and sound. This time, they will be joined by a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Ferrari Testarossa
programme.desc: The Ferrari Testarossa is a dream car, but the 1000 PS Lotec Testarossa is even better and faster. Also: the Porsche Panamera GTS is basically a race car. And: the Wiesmann MF3 is retired with a final edition.

programme.title: Morgan Plus 8
programme.desc: The second generation of the BMW M6, a dream car between sports car and luxury. Also: with the C-X75, the Jaguar shows how the dynamic future could look like. And: after eight years the Morgan Plus 8 is back.

programme.title: Ron Williams and his Cadillac
programme.desc: The 1952 Cadillac Fleetwood is also known as the American Rolls-Royce, because it’s the car of celebrities, presidents, millionaires and mafia bosses. One owner of this rare classic car is German-American actor and entertainer Ron Williams.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera RS
programme.desc: In the early 1970s the Porsche Carrera RS was the fastest and most agile production sports car in Germany. Today the RS is a Porsche classic with highest acclaim.

programme.title: The big journey
programme.desc: The Mercedes-AMG E63 S is a wolf in sheep's clothing. This station wagon has more power than the Nissan GTR 'Godzilla'. Also: the Porsche Panamera GTS feels at home on the motorway and on the race track. And: Audi's powerful all-purpose executive car RS6.

programme.title: Pulse Rising Cars
programme.desc: With the Pulsar, Nissan returned to the European compact class market with a serious contender to the Volkswagen Golf. In addition: the American V8 dream sports car, the Chevrolet Corvette C7. And: Subaru's fifth-generation rally icon, the WRX STI.

programme.title: Wildly through the desert
programme.desc: BMW and the German racing team X-Raid take part in the Dakar Rally with a transformed Mini Countryman. Also: the Mercedes G63 AMG 6x6, a 6-wheel off-road monster. And: the Kia Sportage feels both at home in the rocky terrain of Sicily and the city.

programme.title: Trendy City - SUVs
programme.desc: City-SUVs are the latest trend in the automotive world. The Subaru XV shows its offroad skills, and the Nissan Juke is taken to the race track in Dubai. And: the Mercedes-AMG and the Audi RS Q3 GLA face each other in the mountains.

programme.title: H&R
programme.desc: The leading suspension component manufacturer H&R offers the entire product range from lowering springs to stabilisers and shock absorbers for use in racing and production vehicles.

programme.title: Paravan
programme.desc: The company Paravan creates vehicles for people with disabilities and has developed mobility concepts that are unique worldwide. From the idea to the concept to the production - everything is created here under one roof.

programme.title: Alois Ruf
programme.desc: Alois Ruf is the founder of a small, but well-known car manufacturing company in Bavaria that specialises in building their own vision of street legal super sports cars on the foundation of Porsche bodys.

programme.title: Sabine Schmitz
programme.desc: People called her the "Queen of the Nordschleife" when she used to drive her Porsche or BMW racing cars at the Nürburgring's famous Nordschleife. Sabine Schmitz was a successful racing driver before she took a career turn by working as a TV presenter.

programme.title: All-Wheel-Drive on snow
programme.desc: We spent a day in snowy Austria with rally professional Niki Schelle in a Suzuki SX4 S-Cross. Also: why is the Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution perfect for drifting? And: Mercedes and Chrysler present their all-wheel concept cars.

programme.title: Real Winners
programme.desc: When BMW released the X6 in 2008, many people doubted that this concept would be successful. We took a look at the second generation of this model in the M50d version. Also: test driving the best-selling Opel Mokka. And: the Mercedes GLE Coupe.

programme.title: Cruising
programme.desc: We explored how the Z4 Roadster feels as a cabriolet. Also: the small company Boom Trikes Automotive have become Europe's leading trike manufacturer. And: cruising through Los Angeles in a Volkswagen Beetle convertible.

programme.title: Diesel Engines
programme.desc: It's all about Diesel this time. We compared the BMW 120d and the 125i. In addition: Audi's diesel-hybrid model R18 e-tron quattro dominated the endurance race in Le Mans. And: the diesel-powered Jaguar XF Sport Brake.

programme.title: BMW F 800 R
programme.desc: Stunt world champion Chris Pfeiffer test drives the BMW F 800 R and explains why he is rather excited about the performance and handling of this robust and agile roadster. Also: a look behind the scenes of German helmet manufacturer Schuberth Helme's testing and development procedures. And: German actor Jürgen Vogel puts his new Ducati 1198 SP to the test at the Nürburgring.

programme.title: Stereotypes on Two Wheels
programme.desc: Scooters, stereotypes on two wheels? It doesn't always have to be a classic Vespa! We take a look at three alternatives: Kymco's big scooter xciting 500 i that feels like riding on a sofa, Piaggio's three-wheeler MP3 500 with two front wheels that promises more dynamic driving pleasure and the powerful electric scooter e-max from China.

programme.title: Iconic Racing Classics
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Saalbach Classic 2014
programme.desc: At the 2014 Saalbach Classic rally 80 teams raced their automobile rarities through the Austrian Alps. In addition: rally legend Walter Röhrl in a Porsche 911 RSR at the Cologne-Ahrweiler rally. And: the infamous Group B vehicle category.

programme.title: Offroad for Everybody
programme.desc: Opel's Insignia Tourer Country was the German brand's first family car in outdoor attire. In addition: with the Capture Renault presented their first compact SUV. And: what happens when Fiat's cute compact 500 is inflated to the 500L Trekking?

programme.title: Open Air Concert
programme.desc: As an homage to driving top-down we took a look at three of the most beautiful convertibles. The animalistic sound of the Audi S3 convertible's 4-cylinder is astonishing. But what about the Nissan 370 Z Roadster? Or Porsche's Boxster GTS?

programme.title: Bugatti Galibier
programme.desc: Despite its size the Audi A1 MTM is a real high speed monster. Also: the Bugatti Galibier is one of the fastest sedans in the world. And: only 77 units worldwide, the exclusive Aston Martin One-77.

programme.title: Muscle Cars
programme.desc: For more than 60 years the Corvette has been the embodiment of the American sports car. Also: the Ford Mustang GT, an iconic model with a V8 engine at the price of a Volkswagen Passat. And: the Chevrolet Camaro, another classic from the US.

programme.title: Sedan Offensive
programme.desc: The Volvo S90 offers Scandinavian elegance and a high level of security features. Jaguar entered the race with its performance sedan XF-S and Cadillac ramped up their luxury level with the CT6.

programme.title: The Ten Slowest Cars
programme.desc: Cars are often defined by their speed, but we chose to decelerate things and take a look at our top 10 selection of the most sluggish cars.

programme.title: The Ten Most Fuel-efficient Cars
programme.desc: Not everyone can afford to pay vast sums of money for fuel. We present our top 10 most economical cars in terms of fuel consumption.

programme.title: Jump'n Crash
programme.desc: In this episode of Stunt Heroes, it's all about stunt driver Christoph Knobloch. He drives down a ramp and crashes into cars stacked on top of each other while several petrol barrels explode at the same time.

programme.title: Highfall
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes reveal how spectacular car stunts with big explosions are prepared and which tricks are pulled when you have to blow up a car or jump from a high-rise building.

programme.title: Audi at Le Mans
programme.desc: At the 2012 Le Mans 24 Hours, Audi entered the R18 e-tron quattro for the first time. Also: the Porsche Cayenne GTS, the model between the S and the Turbo. And: the Mercedes-Benz CLS Shooting Brake.

programme.title: Infinity FX50
programme.desc: The evolutionary history of the Infinity FX50, Sebastian Vettel Edition. Also: the Porsche GT2 RS, the most expensive and fastest serial 911 of all times. And: the McLaren MP4 12C GT3, one of the fastest cars in the world.

programme.title: The Greatest Car Legends
programme.desc: There are very special car models that remain in the collective memory for decades and generations. We take a look at the ten most legendary cars.

programme.title: The Strangest Cars
programme.desc: With some cars, you wonder what the designers and manufacturers were thinking. We present what we consider to be the most bizarre cars.

programme.title: Ferrari FF
programme.desc: The Ferrari Four, also called Ferrari FF, is the first four-wheel family car from Maranello. Also: the BMW M5 shines both as a family and business car. And: the Mercedes-Benz SL is a roadster drivers' dream.

programme.title: Luxury 2.0
programme.desc: Lexus was one of the pioneers when it comes to electric and hybrid cars. The brand's LS 600h, the BMW Active Hybrid 7 and the Porsche Panamera S E-Hybrid are prime examples of this mixture between combustion and electric propulsion.

programme.title: First Class for High Income
programme.desc: Audi's coupe RS7 Sportback skillfully combines luxury and power whereas Mercedes' S-Class has always been regarded as a benchmark in the luxury segment. In addition: Abt Sportsline took four of their models to the Festival of Speed in Goodwood, England.

programme.title: Classic Cars with All-Wheel Drive
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Type 166 amphibious vehicle is the all-rounder amongst off-road vehicles. Also: the Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 all-wheeler turned the World Rally Championship in the 1980s on its head. And : the Willys Jeep in our drive report.

programme.title: Mobility in Eastern Europe
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: Sportscars for the Masses
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang has been an icon for decades. What makes this car so special? In addition: the Nissan 370 Z Nismo is half as expensive as a Porsche 911, but its power is on par with the German flagship. And: the 7th generation Volkswagen Golf GTI and R.

programme.title: Electrically into the Future
programme.desc: The Tesla Model S is an icon for inventiveness and boldness. In addition: the BMW i3 was the first car from Germany that completly relied on electric propulsion. And: Citroen gave their glimpse into the future with the DS 5 Hybrid.

programme.title: Primm 300
programme.desc: 500 kilometres of sand and dust. The Primm 300 is the world's toughest desert rally. We accompanied the former European Rally champion Armin Schwarz to one of his toughest challenges, from the first preparations and trial runs to the finish line.

programme.title: The SUV Desert Challenge
programme.desc: Offroad legend Duncan Barbour took a group of men to Oman in order to test the off-road capabilities of the Mercedes-Benz SUV models. Also: how does the Mercedes Benz GL, a 7-seater full-size luxury SUV, perform in the urban jungle of Dubai?

programme.title: KTM 990 Adventure
programme.desc: The big KTM 990 Adventure is Austria’s answer to BMW's bestselling R 1200 GS. Is KTM's allrounder for streets, gravel roads and long distance travels a worthy opponent for the dominating Bavarian bike? Also: travel enduros are put to the test as we accompany two German adventurers on their 31-day, 5800-kilometre bike tour through Thailand, Laos and Cambodia.

programme.title: Stereotypes on Two Wheels
programme.desc: Scooters, stereotypes on two wheels? It doesn't always have to be a classic Vespa! We take a look at three alternatives: Kymco's big scooter xciting 500 i that feels like riding on a sofa, Piaggio's three-wheeler MP3 500 with two front wheels that promises more dynamic driving pleasure and the powerful electric scooter e-max from China.

programme.title: The Beauty is a Beast
programme.desc: We took the Mercedes AMG SLS GT to an airfield and the Porsche 911 Turbo S to the racetrack in order to see these driving machines in action and test their performance. In addition: the Audi R8 4.0 TFSI's innovative lighting technology.

programme.title: Million-Dollar Toys from the Middle East
programme.desc: The McLaren MP4 12C Spider, one of many high-performance sports cars featured at the Doha Motor Show in Qatar. Also: the creations of manufacturers like Lamborghini, Bertone or Porsche but also the first Arab super sports car, the Lykan HyperSport.

programme.title: Episode 12
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Episode 13
programme.desc: The Nuerburgring shook when the VLN began its second leg of the tournament. We once again accompany you to this exciting competition, including the highlights of BMW's 1st leg win.

programme.title: Episode 16
programme.desc: In this episode we invite you to witness the progress of driver Uwe Nittle as he got ready for qualifying at the Truck Grand Prix.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera World Cup
programme.desc: In June 2011 motor sports enthusiasts from all around the world eagerly awaited the start of the Porsche Carrera World Cup at the infamous Nürburgring Nordschleife. We show you some of the most exciting moments of this event.

programme.title: Audi R8 GT vs. Jaguar XKR
programme.desc: The ultimate competition: Aston Martin Virage vs. Jaguar XKR vs. Audi's R8 GT vs. Mercedes SLS. Also: Artega claims that their GT is a 'Porsche killer'. Is that so? And: Formula One champion Sebastian Vettel takes the Infinity FX50 to the test.

programme.title: Low- Price SUVs
programme.desc: Low-priced SUVs frequently lead in the sales statistics and also do fine in independent benchmark tests. We examine the pros and cons of affordable SUVs like the Suzuki Jimny, the Dacia Duster and the Russian SUV veteran, the Lada Niva.

programme.title: Powerful Estate Wagons
programme.desc: Station Wagons like the Volvo V60 Polestar aren't just family vans anymore but basically very roomy sports cars. Mercedes followed a more luxurious approach with their E43 AMG T model. And: the ultimate powerhouse station wagon, the Audi RS6.

programme.title: Audi Sport Quattro S1, Part 1
programme.desc: The Audi Sport quattro S1 is the most powerful and exciting rally car ever built. Based on the regular quattro, the S1 with its giant wings spread anxiety, fear and excitement among rally drivers and fans. Part 1 of 2

programme.title: Volvo 240
programme.desc: The Volvo 240T is a typical family car, it's rather heavy, sedate and not sporty at all. But hardly anyone knows that this Swedish car was once the real deal on the rally race track.

programme.title: Turbo Diesel Power
programme.desc: We took a look at Audi's latest generation of TDI engines and their RS5 TDI Concept. In addition we compared the advantages and disadvantages of the two main fossil fuels for cars, gasoline and diesel. And: the 2014 Porsche Cayenne Diesel.

programme.title: Lightweight Cars
programme.desc: The BMW i8 was one of the first sports cars with some sort of a green image. In addition we took two fly-weight sports cars, the Lotus Elise and the Roding Roadster, to one of the most beautiful alpine pass roads.

programme.title: Touring Car Grand Prix Argentina 1964
programme.desc: Tropical temperatures, clouds of dust and breathtaking curves were some of the many challenges for man and machine during the 1964 Touring Car Grand Prix in Argentina. This race took the Mercedes brand to the top of the international racing teams.

programme.title: The 1994 Indy 500
programme.desc: The Indy 500 is one of the most spectacular racing events in the world. More than 400.000 spectators watch this mixture of show and motorsports competition at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway each year. We take a look back at the 1994 Indy 500.

programme.title: Scrapyard Gold
programme.desc: It is not too unusual to find hidden gems of automotive history in a perfect condition in barns or scrap yards. Also: the MGC GT Sebring, that was built for the 12 Hours of Sebring race.

programme.title: Classic Cars with All-Wheel Drive
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Type 166 amphibious vehicle is the all-rounder amongst off-road vehicles. Also: the Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 all-wheeler turned the World Rally Championship in the 1980s on its head. And : the Willys Jeep in our drive report.

programme.title: Le Mans 1952
programme.desc: The year 1952 saw several premieres at the legendary 24-hour endurance race of Le Mans. After 22 years Mercedes-Benz returned to the famous circuit, and Ferrari started to use factory works team cars for the first time.

programme.title: Rally Argentina 1997
programme.desc: The 1997 Rally Argentina took the drivers and teams to the dusty winding roads of the Andes Mountains in the province of Cordoba. Over the course of 3 days spectators on horseback or on foot watched the 23 stages of the race with excitement.

programme.title: Ferry Porsche
programme.desc: After the Second World War, following in his father's footsteps who had been responsible for the development of the classic Volkswagen, Ferry Porsche laid the foundation for the brand's sports car models like the 356 and later the Porsche 911.

programme.title: Sabine Schmitz
programme.desc: People called her the "Queen of the Nordschleife" when she used to drive her Porsche or BMW racing cars at the Nürburgring's famous Nordschleife. Sabine Schmitz was a successful racing driver before she took a career turn by working as a TV presenter.

programme.title: Touring Car Grand Prix Argentina 1964
programme.desc: Tropical temperatures, clouds of dust and breathtaking curves were some of the many challenges for man and machine during the 1964 Touring Car Grand Prix in Argentina. This race took the Mercedes brand to the top of the international racing teams.

programme.title: The 1994 Indy 500
programme.desc: The Indy 500 is one of the most spectacular racing events in the world. More than 400.000 spectators watch this mixture of show and motorsports competition at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway each year. We take a look back at the 1994 Indy 500.

programme.title: Women and their Classic Cars
programme.desc: A small group of car enthusiastic ladies offers resistance in the otherwise man dominated classic car world. One of them is Johanna. The 24-year-old loves her 1969 Corvette more than everything.

programme.title: Mobility in Eastern Europe
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: Ron Williams and his Cadillac
programme.desc: The 1952 Cadillac Fleetwood is also known as the American Rolls-Royce, because it’s the car of celebrities, presidents, millionaires and mafia bosses. One owner of this rare classic car is German-American actor and entertainer Ron Williams.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera RS
programme.desc: In the early 1970s the Porsche Carrera RS was the fastest and most agile production sports car in Germany. Today the RS is a Porsche classic with highest acclaim.

programme.title: The big journey
programme.desc: The Mercedes-AMG E63 S is a wolf in sheep's clothing. This station wagon has more power than the Nissan GTR 'Godzilla'. Also: the Porsche Panamera GTS feels at home on the motorway and on the race track. And: Audi's powerful all-purpose executive car RS6.

programme.title: Pulse Rising Cars
programme.desc: With the Pulsar, Nissan returned to the European compact class market with a serious contender to the Volkswagen Golf. In addition: the American V8 dream sports car, the Chevrolet Corvette C7. And: Subaru's fifth-generation rally icon, the WRX STI.

programme.title: Wildly through the desert
programme.desc: BMW and the German racing team X-Raid take part in the Dakar Rally with a transformed Mini Countryman. Also: the Mercedes G63 AMG 6x6, a 6-wheel off-road monster. And: the Kia Sportage feels both at home in the rocky terrain of Sicily and the city.

programme.title: Trendy City - SUVs
programme.desc: City-SUVs are the latest trend in the automotive world. The Subaru XV shows its offroad skills, and the Nissan Juke is taken to the race track in Dubai. And: the Mercedes-AMG and the Audi RS Q3 GLA face each other in the mountains.

programme.title: H&R
programme.desc: The leading suspension component manufacturer H&R offers the entire product range from lowering springs to stabilisers and shock absorbers for use in racing and production vehicles.

programme.title: Paravan
programme.desc: The company Paravan creates vehicles for people with disabilities and has developed mobility concepts that are unique worldwide. From the idea to the concept to the production - everything is created here under one roof.

programme.title: Roding
programme.desc: What happens when four engineers fresh out of university are allowed to build a super sports car? One of the rarest and most unusual vehicles there is: the two-seater Roding Roadster.

programme.title: Alois Ruf
programme.desc: Alois Ruf is the founder of a small, but well-known car manufacturing company in Bavaria that specialises in building their own vision of street legal super sports cars on the foundation of Porsche bodys.

programme.title: Sabine Schmitz
programme.desc: People called her the "Queen of the Nordschleife" when she used to drive her Porsche or BMW racing cars at the Nürburgring's famous Nordschleife. Sabine Schmitz was a successful racing driver before she took a career turn by working as a TV presenter.

programme.title: All-Wheel-Drive on snow
programme.desc: We spent a day in snowy Austria with rally professional Niki Schelle in a Suzuki SX4 S-Cross. Also: why is the Mitsubishi Lancer Evolution perfect for drifting? And: Mercedes and Chrysler present their all-wheel concept cars.

programme.title: Real Winners
programme.desc: When BMW released the X6 in 2008, many people doubted that this concept would be successful. We took a look at the second generation of this model in the M50d version. Also: test driving the best-selling Opel Mokka. And: the Mercedes GLE Coupe.

programme.title: Cruising
programme.desc: We explored how the Z4 Roadster feels as a cabriolet. Also: the small company Boom Trikes Automotive have become Europe's leading trike manufacturer. And: cruising through Los Angeles in a Volkswagen Beetle convertible.

programme.title: Diesel Engines
programme.desc: It's all about Diesel this time. We compared the BMW 120d and the 125i. In addition: Audi's diesel-hybrid model R18 e-tron quattro dominated the endurance race in Le Mans. And: the diesel-powered Jaguar XF Sport Brake.

programme.title: BMW F 800 R
programme.desc: Stunt world champion Chris Pfeiffer test drives the BMW F 800 R and explains why he is rather excited about the performance and handling of this robust and agile roadster. Also: a look behind the scenes of German helmet manufacturer Schuberth Helme's testing and development procedures. And: German actor Jürgen Vogel puts his new Ducati 1198 SP to the test at the Nürburgring.

programme.title: Stereotypes on Two Wheels
programme.desc: Scooters, stereotypes on two wheels? It doesn't always have to be a classic Vespa! We take a look at three alternatives: Kymco's big scooter xciting 500 i that feels like riding on a sofa, Piaggio's three-wheeler MP3 500 with two front wheels that promises more dynamic driving pleasure and the powerful electric scooter e-max from China.

programme.title: Iconic Racing Classics
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Saalbach Classic 2014
programme.desc: At the 2014 Saalbach Classic rally 80 teams raced their automobile rarities through the Austrian Alps. In addition: rally legend Walter Röhrl in a Porsche 911 RSR at the Cologne-Ahrweiler rally. And: the infamous Group B vehicle category.

programme.title: Offroad for Everybody
programme.desc: Opel's Insignia Tourer Country was the German brand's first family car in outdoor attire. In addition: with the Capture Renault presented their first compact SUV. And: what happens when Fiat's cute compact 500 is inflated to the 500L Trekking?

programme.title: Open Air Concert
programme.desc: As an homage to driving top-down we took a look at three of the most beautiful convertibles. The animalistic sound of the Audi S3 convertible's 4-cylinder is astonishing. But what about the Nissan 370 Z Roadster? Or Porsche's Boxster GTS?

programme.title: Muscle Cars
programme.desc: For more than 60 years the Corvette has been the embodiment of the American sports car. Also: the Ford Mustang GT, an iconic model with a V8 engine at the price of a Volkswagen Passat. And: the Chevrolet Camaro, another classic from the US.

programme.title: Red Bull Show Run
programme.desc: Red Bull takes a Formula One car on a city tour to promote the New Jersey Grand Prix. Also: Bentley proves that a V8 engine can also set elegant accents. And: McLaren presents the MP4-12 C Spider.

programme.title: Sedan Offensive
programme.desc: The Volvo S90 offers Scandinavian elegance and a high level of security features. Jaguar entered the race with its performance sedan XF-S and Cadillac ramped up their luxury level with the CT6.

programme.title: The Ten Slowest Cars
programme.desc: Cars are often defined by their speed, but we chose to decelerate things and take a look at our top 10 selection of the most sluggish cars.

programme.title: The Ten Most Fuel-efficient Cars
programme.desc: Not everyone can afford to pay vast sums of money for fuel. We present our top 10 most economical cars in terms of fuel consumption.

programme.title: Jump'n Crash
programme.desc: In this episode of Stunt Heroes, it's all about stunt driver Christoph Knobloch. He drives down a ramp and crashes into cars stacked on top of each other while several petrol barrels explode at the same time.

programme.title: Highfall
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes reveal how spectacular car stunts with big explosions are prepared and which tricks are pulled when you have to blow up a car or jump from a high-rise building.

programme.title: Audi at Le Mans
programme.desc: At the 2012 Le Mans 24 Hours, Audi entered the R18 e-tron quattro for the first time. Also: the Porsche Cayenne GTS, the model between the S and the Turbo. And: the Mercedes-Benz CLS Shooting Brake.

programme.title: Infinity FX50
programme.desc: The evolutionary history of the Infinity FX50, Sebastian Vettel Edition. Also: the Porsche GT2 RS, the most expensive and fastest serial 911 of all times. And: the McLaren MP4 12C GT3, one of the fastest cars in the world.

programme.title: The Greatest Car Legends
programme.desc: There are very special car models that remain in the collective memory for decades and generations. We take a look at the ten most legendary cars.

programme.title: The Strangest Cars
programme.desc: With some cars, you wonder what the designers and manufacturers were thinking. We present what we consider to be the most bizarre cars.

programme.title: Luxury 2.0
programme.desc: Lexus was one of the pioneers when it comes to electric and hybrid cars. The brand's LS 600h, the BMW Active Hybrid 7 and the Porsche Panamera S E-Hybrid are prime examples of this mixture between combustion and electric propulsion.

programme.title: First Class for High Income
programme.desc: Audi's coupe RS7 Sportback skillfully combines luxury and power whereas Mercedes' S-Class has always been regarded as a benchmark in the luxury segment. In addition: Abt Sportsline took four of their models to the Festival of Speed in Goodwood, England.

programme.title: Fiat Dino
programme.desc: The Fiat Dino Spider is one of the most beautiful cabriolets of the 1960s. Its impeccable design was created by Pininfarina, and only 525 units were built. Under its hood growls a Ferrari V6 engine.

programme.title: The Most Exciting Classic Car Races
programme.desc: Exciting GT sports cars from the 1960s, the pre-war Silver Arrows, hot classic cars on ice and historic Formula 1 cars. We present the most exciting classic car races in Germany.

programme.title: Driving pleasure in winter
programme.desc: Slippery or muddy roads and bad visibility are circumstances that often spoil driving pleasure in winter. We took two almost identical Porsche 911's to an icy test track. Also: drifting fun in the snow with the Suzuki SX4 S-Cross.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Not only in the big cities it's a growing struggle for parking spots. . We took the BMW X6, the Citroen Cactus and the Smart forfour to town in order to find out how these cars would cope in this situation and surrounding.

programme.title: Maybach Excelero
programme.desc: Fast, expensive and a one-off – the Maybach Exelero. Also: the Custom GT, a super sports car fueled with LPG. And: the new Porsche 911.

programme.title: Infinity FX50
programme.desc: The evolutionary history of the Infinity FX50, Sebastian Vettel Edition. Also: the Porsche GT2 RS, the most expensive and fastest serial 911 of all times. And: the McLaren MP4 12C GT3, one of the fastest cars in the world.

programme.title: Episode 14
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: Episode 15
programme.desc: We present the highlights of last week. The 24 hour race was exciting, as usual. In addition, we explored the 'Strong Man Run' and took a look at the tourist drivers

programme.title: BMW X6M vs Nissan Patrol
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: At Jumeirah Beach in Dubai, car owners can have their souped-up vehicles judged in three categories and win an overnight stay at the Sofitel Hotel. This time, a BMW X6M, a Ford F250 and a Nissan Patrol are in the running.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The "Walk" at JBR in Dubai is the venue for our competition, as far as fancy and luxurious cars from all over the Middle East are concerned. This time, a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet are among the participants.

programme.title: Maybach Excelero
programme.desc: Fast, expensive and a one-off – the Maybach Exelero. Also: the Custom GT, a super sports car fueled with LPG. And: the new Porsche 911.

programme.title: Infinity FX50
programme.desc: The evolutionary history of the Infinity FX50, Sebastian Vettel Edition. Also: the Porsche GT2 RS, the most expensive and fastest serial 911 of all times. And: the McLaren MP4 12C GT3, one of the fastest cars in the world.

programme.title: AMG
programme.desc: The letters AMG sound rather magical in the ears of car enthusiasts. We took a look at some of the company's construction and racing history, their recent creations like the ML 63 SUV, as well as their "Black Series" range of vehicles.

programme.title: Mercedes SLS vs Audi R8
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi once again invite the owners of the most extraordinary cars to Dubai, where they award points for speed, style and sound. This time, they will be joined by a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: BMW X5 vs Mercedes SLK 230
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: If you like souped-up and luxuriously equipped vehicles, Jumeirah Beach in Dubai is the place to be. There, the cars are judged and there is also something to win. This episode features a BMW X5 and a Mercedes SLK 230.

programme.title: Episode 19
programme.desc: The roaring sounds of engines and exhausts usually dominate the Nuerburgring, but we focused on something a bit quieter this time. How about taking part in a 15 mile bike ride around the ring, or perhaps a 16 mile run?

programme.title: Episode 12
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Audi Sport Quattro S1, Part 1
programme.desc: The Audi Sport quattro S1 is the most powerful and exciting rally car ever built. Based on the regular quattro, the S1 with its giant wings spread anxiety, fear and excitement among rally drivers and fans. Part 1 of 2

programme.title: Volvo 240
programme.desc: The Volvo 240T is a typical family car, it's rather heavy, sedate and not sporty at all. But hardly anyone knows that this Swedish car was once the real deal on the rally race track.

programme.title: Northern Tool and Equipment Tools for the Trades™
programme.sub-title: S2025 : E01 Monster Jam Mini Build
programme.desc: Northern Tool’s Tools for the Trades™ program and Monster Jam® partnered to inspire the next generation of tradespeople. Bryan, TX high school students, led by instructor Chris Lehde and Monster Jam mentors Colt Stephens, Armando Castro, Matt DelSanter, and Bill Easterly, were challenged to build a mini Monster Jam truck using a 740cc EFI NorthStar engine and raw steel. The project aimed to spark interest in skilled trades through hands-on experience and monster-sized inspiration.
